Package com.eatthepath.pushy.apns.auth

Class AuthenticationTokenProvider

java.lang.Object
com.eatthepath.pushy.apns.auth.AuthenticationTokenProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class AuthenticationTokenProvider
extends Object
implements Closeable
An authentication token provider provides thread-safe, non-blocking access to a shared AuthenticationToken and refreshes its authentication token at regular intervals.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    AuthenticationTokenProvider​(ApnsSigningKey signingKey, Duration maxTokenAge, ScheduledExecutorService scheduledExecutorService)
    Constructs a new authentication token provider that will generate authentication tokens using the given signing key and refresh the token at the given interval.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void close()
    Shuts down this token provider, cancelling any recurring jobs to refresh tokens.
    void expireAuthenticationToken​(AuthenticationToken expiredToken)
    Marks the given authentication token as "expired," guaranteeing that this provider will not return the given token in subsequent calls.
    AuthenticationToken getAuthenticationToken()
    Returns a current authentication token.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • AuthenticationTokenProvider

      public AuthenticationTokenProvider​(ApnsSigningKey signingKey, Duration maxTokenAge, ScheduledExecutorService scheduledExecutorService)
      Constructs a new authentication token provider that will generate authentication tokens using the given signing key and refresh the token at the given interval. Once constructed, callers must call the constructed instance's close() method to cleanly dispose of the instance.
      Parameters:
      signingKey - the signing key to use to generate authentication tokens
      maxTokenAge - the maximum age of an authentication token before a new token will be generated
      scheduledExecutorService - an executor service to use to schedule token refresh tasks

  • Method Details

    • getAuthenticationToken

      public AuthenticationToken getAuthenticationToken()
      Returns a current authentication token. Subsequent calls to this method may, but are not guaranteed to, return the same token because tokens are refreshed at regular intervals. This method is thread-safe and can be called by any number of concurrent consumers.
      Returns:
      a current authentication token

    • expireAuthenticationToken

      public void expireAuthenticationToken​(AuthenticationToken expiredToken)
      Marks the given authentication token as "expired," guaranteeing that this provider will not return the given token in subsequent calls.
      Parameters:
      expiredToken - the token to mark as expired

    • close

      public void close()
      Shuts down this token provider, cancelling any recurring jobs to refresh tokens. Callers must call this method to cleanly dispose of an authentication token provider.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
